intro.description: Welcome to the "System Information" tutorial. It will help you to get acquainted with the "System Information" perspective.

item.title: Cheat Sheet introduction
item.description: If you need information about how to work with cheat sheets, click on the button with the question mark on the right. To see the contents of the next instruction, you must complete all tasks by clicking on "Click to Complete", or by performing the auto-complete command.

item.title: Open Perspective
item.description: Switch to the "System Information" perspective. Open "Window->Open Perspective->Other..->QNX System Information" from main menu. Click on "Click to Perform" to automatically open the perspective.

item.title: Create Target
item.description: If a target project does not already exist, you can create one in the "Target Navigator" view by right clicking on the canvas and selecting "New QNX Target..." menu. In the dialog, enter the name of the target (any name) and IP address or host name of the target machine.

item.title: System Summary
item.description: Switch to the "System Summary" view. It represents the process information on currently running processes. Select a target in the "Target Navigator" view to see the processes data.

item.title: Process Information view
item.description: Switch to the "Process Information" view. Select the "qconn" process in the "Target Navigator" - "Process Information" updates. Holding Ctrl key select the "procnto" process.

item.title: Memory Information view
item.description: The Memory Information view displays the memory used by the process you select in the Target Navigator view. Switch to the "Memory Information" view. Select the "qconn" process in the "Target Navigator" - view updates.

item.title: System Blocking Graph
item.description: The System Blocking Graph view presents a color-coded display of all the active channels in the system, and illustrates the interaction of the threads with those channels. The Memory Information view displays the memory used by the process you select in the Target Navigator view.

subitem.label: Open the view by selecting "Window->Show View->System Blocking Graph".
Select a "qconn" process to see a graph.

item.title: System Resources
item.description: The System Resources view shows various types of information about your system's processes.

subitem.label: Select the "System Uptime" mode by clicking drop down button (v) in the top right corner of the "System Resources" view.
Click the "Highlight" button (looks like a yellow marker) in the view's toolbar to highlight changes to the display since the last update.
